body:
# kube-client

Crystal client library for the Kubernetes (1.11+) API

[![.github/workflows/ci.yml](https://github.com/spoved/kube-client.cr/actions/workflows/ci.yml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/spoved/kube-client.cr/actions/workflows/ci.yml) [![.github/workflows/docs.yml](https://github.com/spoved/kube-client.cr/actions/workflows/docs.yml/badge.svg)](https://spoved.github.io/kube-client.cr) [![GitHub release](https://img.shields.io/github/release/spoved/kube-client.cr.svg)](https://github.com/spoved/kube-client.cr/releases) [![Chat on Telegram](https://img.shields.io/badge/chat-telegram-blue)](https://t.me/k8s_cr)

## Installation

1. Add the dependency to your `shard.yml`:

   ```yaml
   dependencies:
     kube-client:
       github: spoved/kube-client.cr
   ```

2. Run `shards install`

## Usage

Specify the kubernetes api version of the client to use:

```crystal
require "kube-client/v1.20"

client = Kube::Client.autoconfig
```

Or you can specify the kubernetes api version at compile time via the `-Dk8s_v{major}.{minor}` flag:

```crystal
require "kube-client"

client = Kube::Client.autoconfig
```

```shell
$ crystal build -Dk8s_v1.20 kube-client.cr
```

### Overview

The top-level `Kube::Client` provides access to separate `APIClient` instances for each Kubernetes API Group (`v1`, `apps/v1`, etc.), which in turns provides access to separate `ResourceClient` instances for each API resource type (`nodes`, `pods`, `deployments`, etc.).

Individual resources are returned as `K8S::Kubernetes::Resource` instances, which provide attribute access (`resource.metadata.name`). The resource instances are returned by methods such as `client.api("v1").resource("nodes").get("foo")`, and passed as arguments for `client.api("v1").resource("nodes").create_resource(res)`. Resources can also be loaded from disk using `Kube::Resource.from_files(path)`, and passed to the top-level methods such as `client.create_resource(res)`, which lookup the correct API/Resource client from the resource `apiVersion` and `kind`.

The different `Kube::Error::API` subclasses represent different HTTP response codes, such as `Kube::Error::NotFound` or `Kube::Error::Conflict`.

### Creating a client

#### Unauthenticated client

```crystal
client = Kube.client("https://localhost:6443", ssl_verify_peer: false)
```

The keyword options are [Kube::Transport::Options](src/kube/transport.cr) options.

#### Client from kubeconfig

```crystal
client = Kube::Client.config(
  Kube::Config.load_file(
    File.expand_path "~/.kube/config"
  )
)
```

#### Supported kubeconfig options

Not all kubeconfig options are supported, only the following kubeconfig options work:

- `current-context`
- `context.cluster`
- `context.user`
- `cluster.server`
- `cluster.insecure_skip_tls_verify`
- `cluster.certificate_authority`
- `cluster.certificate_authority_data`
- `user.client_certificate` + `user.client_key`
- `user.client_certificate_data` + `user.client_key_data`
- `user.token`

##### With overrides

```crystal
client = Kube::Client.config(Kube::Config.load_file("~/.kube/config"),
  server: "http://localhost:8001",
)
```

#### In-cluster client from pod envs/secrets

```crystal
client = Kube::Client.in_cluster_config
```

### API Resources

Resources are a sub class of `::K8S::Kubernetes::Resource`, which is generated and defined in the [k8s.cr](https://github.com/spoved/k8s.cr) sub-shard.

Please note that custom resources are not supported at this time.

### Prefetching API resources

Operations like mapping a resource `kind` to an API resource URL require knowledge of the API resource lists for the API group. Mapping resources for multiple API groups would require fetching the API resource lists for each API group in turn, leading to additional request latency. This can be optimized using resource prefetching:

```crystal
client.apis(prefetch_resources: true)
```

This will fetch the API resource lists for all API groups in a single pipelined request.

### Listing resources

```crystal
client.api("v1").resource("pods", namespace: "default").list(label_selector: {"role" => "test"}).each do |pod|
  pod = pod.as(K8S::Api::Core::V1::Pod)
  puts "namespace=#{pod.metadata!.namespace} pod: #{pod.metadata!.name} node=#{pod.spec.try &.node_name}"
end
```

### Updating resources

```crystal
node = client.api("v1").resource("nodes").get("test-node")
node.as(K8S::Api::Core::V1::Node).spec.not_nil!.unschedulable = true
client.api("v1").resource("nodes").update_resource(node)
```

### Deleting resources

```crystal
pod = client.api("v1").resource("pods", namespace: "default").delete("test-pod")
```

```crystal
pods = client.api("v1").resource("pods", namespace: "default").delete_collection(label_selector: {"role" => "test"})
```

### Creating resources

#### Programmatically defined resources

```crystal
pod = K8S::Api::Core::V1::Pod.new(
  metadata: {
    name: "pod-name",
    namespace: "default",
    labels: {
      "app" => "kube-client-test",
    },
  },
  spec: {
    containers: [
      {
        name: "test",
        image: "test",
      },
    ],
  }
)

logger.info "Create pod=#{pod.metadata!.name} in namespace=#{pod.metadata!.namespace}"

pod = client.api("v1").resource("pods").create_resource(pod)
```

#### From file(s)

```crystal
resources = K8S::Kubernetes::Resource.from_file("./test.yaml")

resources = client.create_resources(resources)
```

### Patching resources

```crystal
client.api("apps/v1").resource("deployments", namespace: "default").merge_patch("test", {
    spec: { replicas: 3 },
})
```

### Watching resources

Watching resources spawns a background fiber that will push `K8S::Kubernetes::WatchEvent`s for the resouce onto the returned `Channel`.

```crystal
resource_client = client.api("v1").resource("pods")
channel = resource_client.watch(resource_version: "4651")

while !channel.closed?
  event = channel.receive
  if event.is_a?(Kube::Error::API)
    # Handle error
  else
    pp event # => K8S::Kubernetes::WatchEvent(K8S::Api::Core::V1::Pod)
  end
end
```

## Contributing

1. Fork it (<https://github.com/spoved/kube-client.cr/fork>)
2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b my-new-feature`)
3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am "Add some feature"`)
4. Push to the branch (`git push origin my-new-feature`)
5. Create a new Pull Request

## Contributors

- [Holden Omans](https://github.com/kalinon) - creator and maintainer
- [k8s-client](https://github.com/kontena/k8s-client) - Ruby client this was heavily sourced from

def.name: path
def.body:
if api_version.includes?("/")
  File.join("/apis", api_version)
else
  File.join("/api", api_version)
end

instance_methods.name: api_resources
instance_methods.doc: Cached APIResources

instance_methods.name: api_resources!
instance_methods.doc: Force-update APIResources

def.name: api_resources!
def.body:
logger.trace do
  "Loading API resources for #{path}"
end
@api_resources = ((@transport.get(path, response_class: K8S::Apimachinery::Apis::Meta::V1::APIResourceList)).as(K8S::Apimachinery::Apis::Meta::V1::APIResourceList)).resources
logger.trace do
  "Loaded #{@api_resources.not_nil!.size} API resources for #{path}"
end
@api_resources.not_nil!

instance_methods.name: api_resources?
instance_methods.doc: api_resources loaded yet?

def.name: client_for_resource
def.body:
begin
  logger.trace(&.emit("client_for_resource", api_version: @api_version, kind: kind, namespace: namespace))
  klass = k8s_resource_class("", @api_version, kind)
  if klass
  else
    raise(K8S::Error::UnknownResource.new("Resource #{kind} is not available in #{@api_version}"))
  end
  client_for_resource(klass, namespace)
rescue ex : K8S::Error::UnknownResource
  raise(Kube::Error::UndefinedResource.new("Resource #{kind} is not available in #{@api_version}"))
end

instance_methods.name: client_for_resource
instance_methods.args_string: (resource : X.class, namespace : String | Nil = nil, api_resource : K8S::Apimachinery::Apis::Meta::V1::APIResource | Nil = nil) forall X
instance_methods.args_html: (resource : X.class, namespace : String | Nil = nil, api_resource : K8S::Apimachinery::Apis::Meta::V1::APIResource | Nil = nil) forall X

def.name: client_for_resource
def.body:
begin
  found_resource = api_resource || (find_api_resource_by_kind(resource.kind))
  logger.trace(&.emit("client_for_resource", resource: resource.to_s, namespace: namespace, api_resource: api_resource ? api_resource.kind : nil))
  {% if X.abstract? %}
        case resource.kind
        {% for y in X.all_subclasses %}{% if (!y.abstract?) && (!(y < K8S::Kubernetes::Resource::List)) %}
        when {{ y }}.kind
          ::Kube::ResourceClient({{ y }}).new(@transport, self, found_resource, namespace)
        {% end %}{% end %}
        else
          ::Kube::ResourceClient(X).new(@transport, self, found_resource, namespace)
        end
      {% else %}
        ::Kube::ResourceClient(X).new(@transport, self, found_resource, namespace)
      {% end %}
rescue ex : K8S::Error::UnknownResource
  raise(Kube::Error::UndefinedResource.new("Resource #{resource.kind} is not available in #{@api_version}"))
end

def.name: client_for_resource
def.body:
begin
  if resource.name.includes?("/")
    client_for_subresource(resource, namespace)
  else
    logger.trace(&.emit("client_for_resource", api_resouce: resource.to_json, namespace: namespace))
    klass = K8S::Util.get_resource_klass({api_version: @api_version, kind: resource.kind})
    if klass
    else
      raise(K8S::Error::UnknownResource.new("Resource #{resource.kind} is not available in #{@api_version}"))
    end
    client_for_resource(klass, namespace: namespace, api_resource: resource)
  end
rescue ex : K8S::Error::UnknownResource
  logger.trace(&.emit("client_for_resource: unable to find resouce", api_resouce: resource.to_json, namespace: namespace))
  ::Kube::ResourceClient(K8S::Kubernetes::Resource::Generic).new(@transport, self, resource, namespace)
end

def.name: client_for_subresource
def.body:
parent, subresource = resource.name.split("/", 2)
logger.error(&.emit("client_for_subresource", parent: parent, subresource: subresource, namespace: namespace))
::Kube::ResourceClient(K8S::Kubernetes::Resource::Generic).new(@transport, self, resource, namespace)

instance_methods.name: find_api_resource
instance_methods.doc: raises `K8s::Error::UndefinedResource` if resource not found

def.name: find_api_resource
def.body:
found_resource = api_resources.find do |api_resource|
  api_resource.name == resource_name
end
found_resource || (found_resource = find_api_resource_by_kind(resource_name))
if found_resource
else
  raise(Kube::Error::UndefinedResource.new("Unknown resource #{resource_name} for #{@api_version}"))
end
found_resource

instance_methods.name: find_api_resource_by_kind
instance_methods.doc: raises `K8s::Error::UndefinedResource` if resource not found

def.name: find_api_resource_by_kind
def.body:
found_resource = api_resources.find do |api_resource|
  api_resource.kind == kind
end
if found_resource
else
  raise(Kube::Error::UndefinedResource.new("Unknown resource kind: #{kind} for #{@api_version}"))
end
found_resource

instance_methods.name: list_resources
instance_methods.doc:
Pipeline list requests for multiple resource types.

Returns flattened array with mixed resource kinds.
instance_methods.summary: Pipeline list requests for multiple resource types.

def.name: list_resources
def.body:
logger.trace do
  "list_resources(#{resource_list}, #{options})"
end
if options[:namespace]?
  resource_list || (resource_list = self.resources.select(&.list?).select(&.namespaced?).reject(&.subresource?))
else
  resource_list || (resource_list = self.resources.select(&.list?).reject(&.subresource?))
end
ResourceClient.list(resource_list, @transport, **options)

instance_methods.name: resources
instance_methods.doc: If namespace is given, non-namespaced resources will be skipped
instance_methods.summary: If namespace is given, non-namespaced resources will be skipped

def.name: resources
def.body:
api_resources.map do |api_resource|
  if api_resource.namespaced
    client_for_resource(api_resource, namespace: namespace)
  else
    if namespace.nil?
      client_for_resource(api_resource)
    else
      nil
    end
  end
end.reject(Nil)

def.name: get_token
def.body:
case name
when "gcp"
  Kube::AuthProvider::GCP.get_token(config)
else
  raise("Unsupported auth provider: #{name}")
end

def.name: get_token
def.body:
result = system_cmd(config.cmd_path, config.cmd_args)
if result[:status]
  (JSON.parse(result[:output]))["credential"]["access_token"].as_s
else
  logger.error do
    "Failed to get token from GCP with error: #{result[:error]}"
  end
  raise(Kube::Error::ExecutionError.new(result[:error], result[:status]))
end

types.name: Client
types.doc:
Top-level client wrapper.
Uses a `Transport` instance to talk to the kube API.
Offers access to `Kube::ApiClient` and `ResourceClient` instances.

class_methods.name: autoconfig
class_methods.doc:
Attempts to create a K8s::Client instance automatically using environment variables, existing configuration
files or in cluster configuration.

Look-up order:
  - KUBE_TOKEN, KUBE_CA, KUBE_SERVER environment variables
  - KUBECONFIG environment variable
  - $HOME/.kube/config file
  - In cluster configuration

Will raise when no means of configuration is available
class_methods.summary: Attempts to create a K8s::Client instance automatically using environment variables, existing configuration files or in cluster configuration.

def.name: autoconfig
def.body:
config = if ((ENV.has_key?("KUBE_TOKEN")) && (ENV.has_key?("KUBE_CA"))) && (ENV.has_key?("KUBE_SERVER"))
  kube_ca = Base64.decode_string(ENV["KUBE_CA"])
  if kube_ca =~ (/CERTIFICATE/)
  else
    raise("KUBE_CA does not seem to be base64 encoded")
  end
  kube_token = Base64.decode_string(ENV["KUBE_TOKEN"])
  kube_server = ENV["KUBE_SERVER"]
  Kube::Config.build(kube_server, kube_ca, kube_token)
else
  if ENV.has_key?("KUBECONFIG")
    Kube::Config.from_kubeconfig_env
  else
    found_config = [File.join(Path.home, ".kube", "config"), "/etc/kubernetes/admin.conf", "/etc/kubernetes/kubelet.conf"].find do |path|
      (File.exists?(path)) && (File.readable?(path))
    end
    if found_config
      Kube::Config.load_file(found_config)
    else
      nil
    end
  end
end
if config.nil?
  self.in_cluster_config
else
  self.config(config, namespace, **options)
end

class_methods.name: config
class_methods.args_string: (config : Kube::Config, namespace : String | Nil = nil, **options) : Kube::Client

class_methods.name: in_cluster_config
class_methods.doc: An `Kube::Client` instance from in-cluster config within a kube pod, using the kubernetes service envs and serviceaccount secrets
class_methods.summary: An Kube::Client instance from in-cluster config within a kube pod, using the kubernetes service envs and serviceaccount secrets

instance_methods.name: api
instance_methods.doc: api_version [String] "group/version" or "version" (core)

instance_methods.name: api_groups
instance_methods.doc: Cached /apis preferred group apiVersions

instance_methods.name: api_groups!
instance_methods.doc:
Force-update /apis cache.
Required if creating new CRDs/apiservices.

def.name: api_groups!

instance_methods.name: apis
instance_methods.doc:
api_versions [Array(String)] defaults to all APIs
prefetch_resources [Bool] prefetch any missing api_resources for each api_version
skip_missing [Bool] return Kube::ApiClient without api_resources? if 404
instance_methods.summary: api_versions [Array(String)] defaults to all APIs prefetch_resources [Bool] prefetch any missing api_resources for each api_version skip_missing [Bool] return Kube::ApiClient without api_resources? if 404

def.name: apis
def.body:
api_versions || (api_versions = ["v1"] + api_groups)
if prefetch_resources
  api_paths = api_versions.uniq.reject do |api_version|
    (api(api_version)).api_resources?
  end.map do |api_version|
    Kube::ApiClient.path(api_version)
  end
  begin
    (@transport.gets(api_paths, response_class: K8S::Apimachinery::Apis::Meta::V1::APIResourceList, skip_missing: skip_missing)).each do |api_resource_list|
      if api_resource_list && api_resource_list.is_a?(K8S::Apimachinery::Apis::Meta::V1::APIResource)
        (api(api_resource_list.group_version)).api_resources = api_resource_list.resources
      end
    end
  rescue ex : Kube::Error::NotFound | Kube::Error::ServiceUnavailable
    logger.error do
      ex.message
    end
  end
end
api_versions.map do |api_version|
  api(api_version)
end

instance_methods.name: client_for_resource
instance_methods.args_string: (resource : T.class | T, namespace : String | Nil = nil) forall T
instance_methods.args_html: (resource : T.class | T, namespace : String | Nil = nil) forall T

def.name: client_for_resource
get_resources
def.body:
resource_apis = apis(resources.map(&.api_version), prefetch_resources: true, skip_missing: true)
requests = (resources.zip(resource_apis)).map do |resource, api_client|
  if api_client.api_resources?
  else
    next nil
  end
  resource_client = api_client.client_for_resource(resource)
  {method: "GET", path: resource_client.path(resource.metadata.name, namespace: resource.metadata.namespace), response_class: resource_client.resource_class}
end
K8S::Util.compact_map(requests) do |reqs|
  @transport.requests(*reqs, skip_missing: true)
end

instance_methods.name: list_resources
instance_methods.doc:
Pipeline list requests for multiple resource types.

Returns flattened array with mixed resource kinds.
instance_methods.summary: Pipeline list requests for multiple resource types.

def.name: list_resources
def.body:
begin
  logger.trace do
    "list_resources(#{resource_list}, #{options})"
  end
  resource_list || (resource_list = (self.resources(options[:namespace]?)).select(&.list?))
  logger.trace do
    "list_resources found #{resource_list.size} API resources"
  end
  ResourceClient.list(resource_list, @transport, **options)
rescue ex : Kube::Error::NotFound
  logger.error do
    ex.message
  end
  raise(ex)
end

instance_methods.name: resources
instance_methods.doc: namespace [String, nil]

def.name: resources
def.body:
apis(prefetch_resources: true).flat_map do |api|
  logger.trace do
    "Fetching resources for #{api.api_version}"
  end
  begin
    api.resources(namespace: namespace)
  rescue ex : Kube::Error::ServiceUnavailable | Kube::Error::NotFound
    logger.error do
      ex.message
    end
    Array(Kube::ResourceClient(K8S::Kubernetes::Resource)).new
  end
end

class_methods.name: build
class_methods.doc: Build a minimal configuration from at least a server address, server certificate authority data and an access token.
class_methods.summary: Build a minimal configuration from at least a server address, server certificate authority data and an access token.
class_methods.args_string: (server : String, ca : String, auth_token : String, cluster_name : String = "kubernetes", user : String = "k8s-client", context : String = "k8s-client", **options)
class_methods.args_html: (server : String, ca : String, auth_token : String, cluster_name : String = "kubernetes", user : String = "k8s-client", context : String = "k8s-client", **options)

def.name: build
def.body: new(**{clusters: [Cluster.new(name: cluster_name, cluster: ClusterDef.new(server: server, certificate_authority_data: ca))], users: [User.new(name: user, user: UserDef.new(token: auth_token))], contexts: [Context.new(name: context, context: ContextDef.new(cluster: cluster_name, user: user))], current_context: context}.merge(options))

class_methods.name: from_kubeconfig_env
class_methods.doc:
Loads configuration files listed in KUBE_CONFIG environment variable and
merge using the configuration merge rules, @see K8s::Config.merge
class_methods.summary: Loads configuration files listed in KUBE_CONFIG environment variable and merge using the configuration merge rules, @see K8s::Config.merge

def.name: from_kubeconfig_env
def.body:
kubeconfig || (kubeconfig = ENV.fetch("KUBECONFIG", ""))
if kubeconfig.empty?
  raise(Error.new("KUBECONFIG not set"))
end
paths = kubeconfig.split(/(?!\\):/)
config = new()
paths.each do |path|
  if File.exists?(path)
  else
    raise(Error.new("KUBECONFIG file not found: #{path}"))
  end
  config.merge!(load_file(path))
end
config

class_methods.name: load_file
class_methods.doc: Loads a configuration from a YAML file
class_methods.summary: Loads a configuration from a YAML file

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (clusters : Array(Kube::Config::Cluster), contexts : Array(Kube::Config::Context), current_context : Nil | String, preferences : Hash(String, String) = Hash(String, String).new, users : Array(Kube::Config::User) = Array(User).new, api_version : String = "v1", kind : String = "Config")
constructors.args_html: (clusters : Array(Kube::Config::Cluster), contexts : Array(Kube::Config::Context), current_context : Nil | String, preferences : Hash(String, String) = Hash(String, String).new, users : Array(Kube::Config::User) = Array(User).new, api_version : String = "v1", kind : String = "Config")

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(clusters, contexts, current_context, preferences, users, api_version, kind)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

instance_methods.name: cluster
instance_methods.doc: Returns the cluster with the given `name` or the cluster of the current context
instance_methods.summary: Returns the cluster with the given name or the cluster of the current context

def.name: cluster
def.body:
if name.nil?
  name = context.cluster
end
clusters.find do |c|
  c.name == name
end || (raise(Error.new("cluster not found: #{name.inspect}")))

instance_methods.name: context
instance_methods.doc: Returns the context with the given `name` or the current context
instance_methods.summary: Returns the context with the given name or the current context

def.name: context
def.body:
if name.nil?
  name = current_context
end
if name.nil?
  raise(Error.new("no context set"))
end
contexts.find do |c|
  c.name == name
end || (raise(Error.new("context not found: #{name.inspect}")))

instance_methods.name: merge
instance_methods.doc:
Merges configuration according to the rules specified in
https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/organize-cluster-access-kubeconfig/#merging-kubeconfig-files
instance_methods.summary: Merges configuration according to the rules specified in https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/organize-cluster-access-kubeconfig/#merging-kubeconfig-files

def.name: merge
def.body: Config.new(clusters: merge_arrays(clusters.dup, other.clusters), contexts: merge_arrays(contexts.dup, other.contexts), current_context: current_context || other.current_context, preferences: preferences.dup.merge(other.preferences), users: merge_arrays(users.dup, other.users), api_version: api_version, kind: kind)

def.name: merge!
def.body:
merge_arrays(clusters, other.clusters)
merge_arrays(contexts, other.contexts)
self.current_context = self.current_context || other.current_context
preferences.merge!(other.preferences)
merge_arrays(users, other.users)
self

instance_methods.name: user
instance_methods.doc: Returns the user with the given `name` or the user of the current context
instance_methods.summary: Returns the user with the given name or the user of the current context

def.name: user
def.body:
if name.nil?
  name = context.user
end
users.find do |u|
  u.name == name
end || (raise(Error.new("user not found: #{name.inspect}")))

constructors.args_string: (server : String, certificate_authority : Nil | String = nil, certificate_authority_data : Nil | String = nil, insecure_skip_tls_verify : Bool = false)

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (cluster : String, user : String, namespace : Nil | String = nil)
constructors.args_html: (cluster : String, user : String, namespace : Nil | String = nil)

types.name: NamespacedName
types.doc:
NamespacedName comprises a resource name, with a mandatory namespace,
rendered as "<namespace>/<name>".  Being a type captures intent and
helps make sure that UIDs, namespaced names and non-namespaced names
do not get conflated in code.  For most use cases, namespace and name
will already have been format validated at the API entry point, so we
don't do that here.
types.summary: NamespacedName comprises a resource name, with a mandatory namespace, rendered as "/".

types.name: NodeName
types.doc:
NodeName is a type that holds a api.Node's Name identifier.
Being a type captures intent and helps make sure that the node name
is not confused with similar concepts (the hostname, the cloud provider id,
the cloud provider name etc)

To clarify the various types:

* Node.Name is the Name field of the Node in the API.  This should be stored in a NodeName.
  Unfortunately, because Name is part of ObjectMeta, we can't store it as a NodeName at the API level.

* Hostname is the hostname of the local machine (from uname -n).
  However, some components allow the user to pass in a --hostname-override flag,
  which will override this in most places. In the absence of anything more meaningful,
  kubelet will use Hostname as the Node.Name when it creates the Node.

* The cloudproviders have the own names: GCE has InstanceName, AWS has InstanceId.

  For GCE, InstanceName is the Name of an Instance object in the GCE API.  On GCE, Instance.Name becomes the
  Hostname, and thus it makes sense also to use it as the Node.Name.  But that is GCE specific, and it is up
  to the cloudprovider how to do this mapping.

  For AWS, the InstanceID is not yet suitable for use as a Node.Name, so we actually use the
  PrivateDnsName for the Node.Name.  And this is _not_ always the same as the hostname: if
  we are using a custom DHCP domain it won't be.
types.summary: NodeName is a type that holds a api.Node's Name identifier.

types.name: PatchType
types.doc:
These are constants to support HTTP PATCH utilized by
both the client and server that didn't make sense for a whole package to be
dedicated to.
types.summary: These are constants to support HTTP PATCH utilized by both the client and server that didn't make sense for a whole package to be dedicated to.

def.name: to_s
def.body:
case self
when JSON
  io << "application/json"
when Merge
  io << "application/merge-patch+json"
when StrategicMerge
  io << "application/strategic-merge-patch+json"
when Apply
  io << "application/apply-patch+yaml"
end

types.name: ResourceClient
types.doc:
Per-APIResource type client.

Used to get/list/update/patch/delete specific types of resources, optionally in some specific namespace.

class_methods.name: list
class_methods.doc:
Pipeline list requests for multiple resource types.

Returns flattened array with mixed resource kinds.

`skip_forbidden` [Boolean] skip resources that return HTTP 403 errors
class_methods.summary: Pipeline list requests for multiple resource types.
class_methods.args_string: (resources : Array(ResourceClient), transport : Transport, namespace : String | Nil = nil, label_selector = nil, field_selector = nil, skip_forbidden = false) : Indexable
class_methods.args_html: (resources : Array(ResourceClient), transport : Transport, namespace : String | Nil = nil, label_selector = nil, field_selector = nil, skip_forbidden = false) : Indexable

def.name: list
def.body:
api_paths = resources.map(&.path(namespace: namespace))
api_lists = transport.gets(api_paths, response_class: K8S::Kubernetes::Resource, query: make_query({"labelSelector" => selector_query(label_selector), "fieldSelector" => selector_query(field_selector)}), skip_forbidden: skip_forbidden)
(resources.zip(api_lists)).flat_map do |resource, api_list|
  api_list ? resource.process_list(api_list) : nil
end.reject(Nil)

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (transport : Kube::Transport, api_client : Kube::ApiClient, api_resource : K8S::Apimachinery::Apis::Meta::V1::APIResource, namespace : Nil | String = nil)
constructors.args_html: (transport : Kube::Transport, api_client : Kube::ApiClient, api_resource : K8S::Apimachinery::Apis::Meta::V1::APIResource, namespace : Nil | String = nil)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = ResourceClient(T).allocate
_.initialize(transport, api_client, api_resource, namespace)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

def.name: path
process_list
def.body:
if (list.is_a?(K8S::Kubernetes::Resource::List(T)))
  list.items
else
  logger.error do
    "Unexpected list type: #{list.class}"
  end
  Array(T).new
end

instance_methods.name: watch
instance_methods.args_string: (label_selector : String | Hash(String, String) | Nil = nil, field_selector : String | Hash(String, String) | Nil = nil, resource_version : String | Nil = nil, timeout : Int32 | Nil = nil, namespace = @namespace) : Kube::WatchChannel(T)
instance_methods.args_html: (label_selector : String | Hash(String, String) | Nil = nil, field_selector : String | Hash(String, String) | Nil = nil, resource_version : String | Nil = nil, timeout : Int32 | Nil = nil, namespace = @namespace) : Kube::WatchChannel(T)

def.name: watch
def.body:
query = make_query({"labelSelector" => selector_query(label_selector), "fieldSelector" => selector_query(field_selector), "resourceVersion" => resource_version, "timeoutSeconds" => timeout, "watch" => "true"})
logger.warn do
  "Watching #{query}"
end
wc = Kube::WatchChannel(T).new(@transport)
@transport.watch_request(path: path(namespace: namespace), query: query, response_class: K8S::Kubernetes::WatchEvent(T), response_channel: wc.channel)
wc

def.name: make_query
def.body:
query = Hash(String, String | Array(String)).new
options.each do |k, v|
  if v.nil?
  else
    query[k] = v
  end
end
if query.empty?
  return nil
end
query

instance_methods.name: selector_query
instance_methods.args_string: (selector : String | Symbol | Hash(String, String) | Nil) : String | Nil
instance_methods.args_html: (selector : String | Symbol | Hash(String, String) | Nil) : String | Nil

def.name: selector_query
def.body:
case selector
when Nil
  nil
when Symbol
  selector.to_s
when String
  selector
when Hash
  selector.map do |k, v|
    "#{k}=#{v}"
  end.join(",")
else
  raise(Kube::Error.new("Invalid selector type. #{selector.inspect}"))
end

constructors.args_html: (server : String, auth_token : String | Nil = nil, auth_username : String | Nil = nil, auth_password : String | Nil = nil, pool_options : PoolOptions = PoolOptions.new, **options)

instance_methods.name: _watch_request
instance_methods.args_string: (response_class : T, response_channel, path, req_options) forall T
instance_methods.args_html: (response_class : T, response_channel, path, req_options) forall T

def.name: _watch_request
def.body:
begin
  using_connection do |client|
    client.exec(method: "GET", path: path, headers: req_options[:headers]?) do |response|
      if response.success?
        io = response.body_io
        while !io.closed?
          raw_event = io.gets
          if raw_event
            event = response_class.from_json(raw_event)
            if response_channel.closed?
              io.close
              break
            end
            begin
              response_channel.send(event)
            rescue ex : Channel::ClosedError
              if io.closed?
              else
                io.close
              end
              break
            end
          end
        end
      else
        raise(Kube::Error::API.new("GET", path, response.status, response.body))
      end
    end
  end
rescue ex : Kube::Error::API
  response_channel.send(ex)
  response_channel.close
rescue ex
  response_channel.close
  raise(ex)
end

def.name: format_request
def.body:
method = options[:method]
path = options[:path]
body = nil
if obj = options[:request_object]?
  body = "<#{obj.class.name}>"
end
[method, path, body].compact.join(" ")

instance_methods.name: gets
instance_methods.args_html: (paths : Array(String), response_class : T.class, **options) forall T

def.name: gets
gets

instance_methods.name: need_delete_body?
instance_methods.doc: Returns true if delete options should be sent as bode of the DELETE request
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if delete options should be sent as bode of the DELETE request

instance_methods.name: parse_response
instance_methods.args_string: (response : HTTP::Client::Response, method : String, path : String, response_class : T.class | Nil = nil, **options) forall T
instance_methods.args_html: (response : HTTP::Client::Response, method : String, path : String, response_class : T.class | Nil = nil, **options) forall T

def.name: parse_response
def.body:
content_type = (response.headers["Content-Type"].split(';', 2)).first
if response.success?
  _parse_resp(method, path, response, content_type, response_class)
else
  response_data = _parse_resp(method, path, response, content_type)
  if response_data.is_a?(K8S::Apimachinery::Apis::Meta::V1::Status)
    raise(Kube::Error::API.new(method, path, response.status, response_data))
  else
    if (response_data.is_a?(JSON::Any) || response_data.is_a?(YAML::Any)) && ((response_data["kind"]? == "Status") && (response_data["apiVersion"]? == "v1"))
      raise(Kube::Error::API.new(method, path, response.status, K8S::Apimachinery::Apis::Meta::V1::Status.from_json(response.body)))
    else
      raise(Kube::Error::API.new(method, path, response.status, response.body))
    end
  end
end

def.name: path
def.body:
(if path.first == path_prefix
  File.join(path)
else
  File.join(path_prefix, *path)
end).gsub(/\/\//, "/")

instance_methods.name: request
instance_methods.args_string: (response_class : T.class, response_block : Proc | Nil = nil, **options) forall T
instance_methods.args_html: (response_class : T.class, response_block : Proc | Nil = nil, **options) forall T

def.name: request
def.body:
begin
  opts = options.to_h
  req_options = if (opts[:method]? == "DELETE") && need_delete_body?
    request_options(**options.merge({request_object: opts.reject(:query)}))
  else
    request_options(**options)
  end
  t1 = Time.monotonic
  response = _request(options, req_options)
  t = Time.monotonic - t1
  obj = parse_response(**options, response: response, response_class: response_class)
rescue ex : K8S::Error::UnknownResource
  logger.warn do
    "#{format_request(options)} => HTTP #{ex} in #{t}s"
  end
  if req_options.nil?
  else
    logger.debug do
      "Request: #{req_options}"
    end
  end
  if response.nil?
  else
    logger.debug do
      "Response: #{response.body}"
    end
  end
  nil
rescue ex
  logger.warn do
    "#{format_request(options)} => HTTP #{ex} in #{t}s"
  end
  if req_options.nil?
  else
    logger.debug do
      "Request: #{req_options}"
    end
  end
  if response.nil?
  else
    logger.debug do
      "Response: #{response.body}"
    end
  end
  raise(ex)
else
  if req_options.nil?
  else
    logger.debug do
      "Request: #{req_options}"
    end
  end
  logger.debug do
    "Response: #{response.body}"
  end
  logger.info do
    "#{format_request(options)} => HTTP #{response.status}: #{obj.inspect} in #{t}s"
  end
  obj
end

def.name: request_options
def.body:
headers = HTTP::Headers {"Content-Type" => content_type, "Accept" => "application/json", "User-Agent" => "kube-client.cr/#{Kube::Client::VERSION}"}
if @auth_token
  headers["Authorization"] = "Bearer #{@auth_token}"
else
  if @auth_username && @auth_password
    headers["Authorization"] = "Basic #{Base64.strict_encode("#{@auth_username}:#{@auth_password}")}"
  end
end
if ((request_object.is_a?(::JSON::Serializable) || request_object.is_a?(NamedTuple)) || request_object.is_a?(Hash)) || request_object.is_a?(K8S::Kubernetes::Object)
  options.merge(headers: headers, body: request_object.to_json, query: options[:query]?)
else
  options.merge(headers: headers, query: options[:query]?)
end

instance_methods.name: requests
instance_methods.args_string: (options : Enumerable(W), skip_missing = false, skip_forbidden = false, retry_errors = true, skip_unknown = true, **common_options) forall W
instance_methods.args_html: (options : Enumerable(W), skip_missing = false, skip_forbidden = false, retry_errors = true, skip_unknown = true, **common_options) forall W

def.name: requests
def.body:
begin
  t1 = Time.monotonic
  responses = options.map do |opts|
    _request(opts, common_options)
  end
  t = Time.monotonic - t1
  objects = (responses.zip(options)).map do |response, request_options|
    begin
      parse_response(**request_options.merge({response: response}))
    rescue e : Kube::Error::UndefinedResource | K8S::Error::UnknownResource
      if skip_unknown
      else
        raise(e)
      end
      nil
    rescue e : Kube::Error::NotFound
      if skip_missing
      else
        raise(e)
      end
      nil
    rescue e : Kube::Error::Forbidden
      if skip_forbidden
      else
        raise(e)
      end
      nil
    rescue e : Kube::Error::ServiceUnavailable
      if retry_errors
      else
        raise(e)
      end
      logger.warn do
        "Retry #{format_request(request_options)} => HTTP #{e.code} #{e.reason} in #{t}"
      end
      request(**common_options.merge(request_options))
    end
  end
rescue e : Kube::Error::API
  logger.warn do
    "[#{options.map do |o|
      format_request(o)
    end.join(", ")}] => HTTP #{e.code} #{e.reason} in #{t}"
  end
  raise(e)
else
  logger.info do
    "[#{options.map do |o|
      format_request(o)
    end.join(", ")}] => HTTP [#{responses.map(&.status).join(", ")}] in #{t}"
  end
  objects
end

instance_methods.name: requests
instance_methods.args_string: (*options, skip_missing = false, skip_forbidden = false, retry_errors = true, skip_unknown = true, **common_options)
instance_methods.args_html: (*options, skip_missing = false, skip_forbidden = false, retry_errors = true, skip_unknown = true, **common_options)

def.name: watch_request
def.body:
req_options = request_options(**options)
path = _request_path(options, req_options[:query]?)
spawn(_watch_request(response_class, response_channel, path, req_options))

instance_methods.name: config
instance_methods.doc: ameba:disable Metrics/CyclomaticComplexity
instance_methods.args_string: (conf : Kube::Config, server : String | Nil = nil, **overrides) : Kube::Transport

def.name: config
def.body:
server || (server = conf.cluster.server)
if server.nil?
  raise(Kube::Error::MissingConfig.new("server"))
end
options : Hash(Symbol, String | OpenSSL::SSL::VerifyMode | Nil) = Options.new(client_cert: nil, client_key: nil, ssl_ca_file: nil, verify_ssl: OpenSSL::SSL::VerifyMode::PEER, auth_username: nil, auth_password: nil, auth_token: nil, auth_token_file: nil).to_h
if conf.cluster.insecure_skip_tls_verify
  logger.debug do
    "Using config with .cluster.insecure_skip_tls_verify"
  end
  options[:verify_ssl] = OpenSSL::SSL::VerifyMode::NONE
end
if path = conf.cluster.certificate_authority
  logger.debug do
    "Using config with .cluster.certificate_authority"
  end
  options[:ssl_ca_file] = path
end
if data = conf.cluster.certificate_authority_data
  logger.debug do
    "Using config with .cluster.certificate_authority_data"
  end
  tmpfile = File.tempfile("kube-client-ca")
  File.write(tmpfile.path, Base64.decode_string(data))
  options[:ssl_ca_file] = tmpfile.path
  at_exit do
    tmpfile.delete
  end
end
if (cert = conf.user.client_certificate) && (key = conf.user.client_key)
  logger.debug do
    "Using config with .user.client_certificate/client_key"
  end
  options[:client_cert] = cert
  options[:client_key] = key
end
if (cert_data = conf.user.client_certificate_data) && (key_data = conf.user.client_key_data)
  logger.debug do
    "Using config with .user.client_certificate_data/client_key_data"
  end
  crtfile = File.tempfile("kube-client-crt")
  File.write(crtfile.path, Base64.decode_string(cert_data))
  options[:client_cert] = crtfile.path
  at_exit do
    crtfile.delete
  end
  keyfile = File.tempfile("kube-client-crt")
  File.write(keyfile.path, Base64.decode_string(key_data))
  options[:client_key] = keyfile.path
  at_exit do
    keyfile.delete
  end
end
if token = conf.user.token
  logger.debug do
    "Using config with .user.token=..."
  end
  options[:auth_token] = token
else
  if conf.user.auth_provider && conf.user.auth_provider.not_nil!.config
    auth_provider = conf.user.auth_provider.not_nil!
    logger.debug do
      "Using config with .user.auth-provider.name=#{auth_provider.name}"
    end
    options[:auth_token] = token_from_auth_provider(auth_provider)
  else
    if exec_conf = conf.user.exec
      logger.debug do
        "Using config with .user.exec.command=#{exec_conf.command}"
      end
      options[:auth_token] = token_from_exec(exec_conf)
    else
      if conf.user.username && conf.user.password
        logger.debug do
          "Using config with .user.password=..."
        end
        options[:auth_username] = conf.user.username.not_nil!
        options[:auth_password] = conf.user.password.not_nil!
      end
    end
  end
end
logger.info do
  "Using config with server=#{server}"
end
opts = (Options.from(options)).merge(overrides)
new(server, **opts)

instance_methods.name: in_cluster_config
instance_methods.doc:
In-cluster config within a kube pod, using the kubernetes service envs and serviceaccount secrets
raises [Kube::Error::MissingEnv] if the required env vars are not set
instance_methods.summary: In-cluster config within a kube pod, using the kubernetes service envs and serviceaccount secrets raises [Kube::Error::MissingEnv] if the required env vars are not set

def.name: in_cluster_config
def.body:
host = ENV.fetch("KUBERNETES_SERVICE_HOST", "")
if host.empty?
  raise(Kube::Error::MissingEnv.new("KUBERNETES_SERVICE_HOST"))
end
port = ENV.fetch("KUBERNETES_SERVICE_PORT_HTTPS", "")
if port.empty?
  raise(Kube::Error::MissingEnv.new("KUBERNETES_SERVICE_PORT_HTTPS"))
end
new("https://#{host}:#{port}", **options.merge({verify_ssl: OpenSSL::SSL::VerifyMode::PEER, ssl_ca_file: File.join(ENV.fetch("TELEPRESENCE_ROOT", "/"), "var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/ca.crt"), auth_token: File.read(File.join(ENV.fetch("TELEPRESENCE_ROOT", "/"), "var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/token"))}))

def.name: token_from_auth_provider
def.body:
case auth_provider.name
when "gcp"
  Kube::AuthProvider::GCP.get_token(auth_provider.config)
else
  raise("Unknown auth provider type: #{auth_provider.name}")
end

instance_methods.name: token_from_exec
instance_methods.doc: raises [Kube::Error::ExecutionError] if the request fails

def.name: token_from_exec
def.body:
logger.debug do
  "Executing #{conf.command} #{conf.args.join(" ")}"
end
env = conf.env.to_h do |e|
  {e.name, e.value}
end
result = system_cmd(conf.command, conf.args, env)
if result[:status]
  logger.debug do
    "Executed #{conf.command} #{conf.args.join(" ")} successfully"
  end
  token = ((JSON.parse(result[:output])).dig?("status", "token")).try(&.as_s)
  if token.nil?
    raise(Kube::Error::ExecutionError.new("Failed to get token from #{conf.command} #{conf.args.join(" ")}: #{result[:output]}", result[:status]))
  end
  token
else
  logger.error do
    "Executed #{conf.command} #{conf.args.join(" ")} with error #{result[:error]}"
  end
  raise(Kube::Error::ExecutionError.new(result[:error], result[:status]))
end

types.name: Options
types.aliased: NamedTuple(client_cert: String | Nil, client_key: String | Nil, ssl_ca_file: String | Nil, verify_ssl: LibSSL::VerifyMode, auth_username: String | Nil, auth_password: String | Nil, auth_token: String | Nil, auth_token_file: String | Nil)
types.aliased_html: {client_cert: String?, client_key: String?, ssl_ca_file: String?, verify_ssl: LibSSL::VerifyMode, auth_username: String?, auth_password: String?, auth_token: String?, auth_token_file: String?}

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (pool_capacity : Int32 = 200, initial_pool_size : Int32 = 20, pool_timeout : Float64 = 0.1, sleep_time : Float64 = 0.1)
constructors.args_html: (pool_capacity : Int32 = 200, initial_pool_size : Int32 = 20, pool_timeout : Float64 = 0.1, sleep_time : Float64 = 0.1)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(pool_capacity, initial_pool_size, pool_timeout, sleep_time)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

types.name: UID
types.doc:
UID is a type that holds unique ID values, including UUIDs.  Because we
don't ONLY use UUIDs, this is an alias to string.  Being a type captures
intent and helps make sure that UIDs and names do not get conflated.
types.summary: UID is a type that holds unique ID values, including UUIDs.
